title: Compute mean number of people in cars on highway

content.description:
A city department of transportation studied traffic congestion on a certain highway. To encourage carpooling, the department will recommend a carpool lane if the average number of people in passenger cars on the highway is less than <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>. The probability distribution of the number of people in passenger cars on the highway is shown in the table.

Number of people
 <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="4" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="5" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

Probability
 <math alttext="0.56" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.56</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="0.28" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.28</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="0.08" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.08</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="0.06" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.06</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="0.02" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.02</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
content.question: Based on the probability distribution, what is the mean number of people in passenger cars on the highway?

unit.text: 4: Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions

topic.text: 4.8: Mean and Standard Deviation of Random Variables

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Determine parameters for probability distributions.
